answers.text:
Our policy requires employees to stay on one year after they receive reimbursement. If they leave before that time, they are required to pay back the tuition on a pro rata basis of one-twelfth per month. The policy is the same regardless of cost or degree attained.

author: Tim Cox
text:
For cities that offer education or other training reimbursement to employees... 
What is your policy in regards to the employee's commitment to the City after the completion of classes or training? In most cases, I am finding a one year commitment by the employee (from the completion date of the courses) or all costs must be paid back to the City (assuming the employee's position was not deleted or some other similar circumstance).
Does the commitment requirement fluctuate based on the overall cost? For example, one year of an advanced degree program may cost around  $10,000 whereas 1 year in a specific training program may cost only $3,000. Would both of these programs require the same time commitment? Or, is there a formula that your City uses to determine the commitment?
If you want to email your response privately, I can be reached at tcox@fairburn.com 
Thanks for your assistance with this!
title: Education/Training Reimbursement
